item.title: By: will
item.dc:creator: will
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/05/08/absolute-beginners-guide-to-google-maps-javascript/#comment-12">Travis</a>.
Hi Travis. I feel your pain, I really do. I try and find some time to re-work the examples over the coming weeks. No promises though! It looks like winter might finally be over and I've got some golf to play. :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Travis.

Hi Travis. I feel your pain, I really do. I try and find some time to re-work the examples over the coming weeks. No promises though! It looks like winter might finally be over and I’ve got some golf to play. ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Travis
item.dc:creator: Travis
item.description: Can you update this code for Google Maps API V3? When I use the above, the map appears on my page momentarily and then disappears after a message pops up telling me something about the javascript being rejected by the browser because it's not V3. Any updates are immensely appreciated.
item.content:encoded: Can you update this code for Google Maps API V3? When I use the above, the map appears on my page momentarily and then disappears after a message pops up telling me something about the javascript being rejected by the browser because it’s not V3. Any updates are immensely appreciated.

item.title: By: Steve
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description:
In the google map example site. when I click this link, it shows map
https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/examples/map-simple-async
But when I save that html file into my HDD and double click the file, nothing shows up in the chrome browser.
This seems very strange to me. I am new to Javascript.
item.content:encoded:
In the google map example site. when I click this link, it shows map

https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/examples/map-simple-async

But when I save that html file into my HDD and double click the file, nothing shows up in the chrome browser.

This seems very strange to me.
I am new to Javascript.

item.description: [...] A mate of mine has been building a relatively complex website for Potton, the town he lives in.
